name: Arcade Hits: Outlaws of the Lost Dynasty
name_original: Arcade Hits: Outlaws of the Lost Dynasty
description:
Purchase this PS one® Classic and play it on both your PS3™ and PSP® (PlayStation®Portable) systems!

Download this PS one® Classic today!

The story is based in feudal China, like so many fighters of that era. But what separates the game from others is its hand-to-hand combat play. If you wish to throw down your weapon and fight like a man, you’re efforts will be paid off in more visceral attacks and better combos. This is a nice flight from others in the genre as it adds a twist where you may not expect.

Outlaws of the Lost Dynasty is standard 2D fighting fare with quarter circles, charge moves, combos, and special moves. Like most Data East fighters, the depth lies in the linking together of standard and special attacks, and pulling off what air juggling is possible within the system. The character animation in this series is particularly smooth and fluid for the time, and while it’s certainly not a modern fighter, it holds up surprisingly well.

Please Note: This game is a direct import from Japan. Although text is limited, it is in the its original Japanese language. Help with playing can be found at www.monkeypawgames.com.

Transferring to a PSP® system from your PS3™ system:

You must be signed into the PlayStation®Network account that originally purchased the game. You must have at least 100 MB free on your Memory Stick Duo™. Connect your PSP® system to your PS3™ system with a USB cable and switch your PSP® system to USB Mode. Highlight the game on the PS3™ XMB™, press the Δ button and select Copy.

PC Store Customers:
Log into your PlayStation®Network account that you originally used to purchased the game. Then, download the game from your “Download List” in the PlayStation®Store onto your PS3™ system.

This title has been converted from the original PlayStation® disc to the PSP® and the PS3™ systems. Consequently, there may be times where the title plays differently from the PlayStation® disc version, or where some features may not function properly. This version does not support PlayStation® peripherals (controller, memory card, multitap, etc.), therefore functionalities such as multiplayer, versus, and co-op modes are not available.
